page.title: 08STANSTED AIRPORT
page.content: Stansted Airport, East of Bishop's Stortford in Essex has been confirmed as London's third airport. It is going to be increased in size so it can take more passengers. At the moment Stansted is taking 2 M. passengers a year, but when it is expanded Stansted will take 9M. passengers a year. It's development will almost certainly affect our area. As well as boosting the amount of planes over Sawbridgeworth/High Wych which will increase aircraft noise drasticaly it will also increase traffic through this area. More people will probably want to live locally because of the expansion. An extra bypass is being considered to run around Bishop's Stortford. The extension of Stansted will create new jobs. It will also have a new terminal.Most local people are against the expansion of Stansted.
